title: Understanding MDD Symptoms
text: Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) is characterized by a variety of symptoms that affect different aspects of a person's life. These symptoms can be physical, emotional, or cognitive.

title: Physical Symptoms of MDD
text: Individuals with MDD may experience significant changes in appetite or weight, and sleep disturbances such as insomnia or hypersomnia.

title: Emotional Symptoms of MDD
text: Feelings of worthlessness or excessive guilt are common emotional symptoms associated with MDD.

title: Cognitive Symptoms of MDD
text: Difficulty concentrating or making decisions is a cognitive symptom often seen in individuals with MDD.

title: Suicidal Ideation in MDD
text: Recurrent thoughts of death or suicidal ideation are serious symptoms that can occur in individuals with MDD.

hintAnswer: significant changes in appetite or weight, sleep disturbances (either insomnia or hypersomnia), fatigue, feelings of worthlessness or excessive guilt, difficulty concentrating or making decisions, and recurrent thoughts of death or suicidal ideation
title: Identifying MDD Symptoms
text: Based on the DSM-5 criteria, which of the following are symptoms of Major Depressive Disorder?
choices: significant changes in appetite or weight, sleep disturbances (either insomnia or hypersomnia), fatigue, feelings of worthlessness or excessive guilt, difficulty concentrating or making decisions, and recurrent thoughts of death or suicidal ideation
difficulty concentrating or making decisions, and recurrent thoughts of death or suicidal ideation
increase in appetite or weight, sleep disturbances (either insomnia or hypersomnia), fatigue
